result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J. Holman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas J. Holman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas J. Holman was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Release of restitution. ck #17CH077866

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Lauren Breckenfelder.  Deft paid $1400 towards restitution on 11/28/16 - believes it is paid in full.  Court instructed deft to stop in rm 204 to make sure it has been paid in full.  No further court taken taken.
Email received from Shane G which states the deft paid $1400 towards restitution today.  Hrg for 12/15/16 to remain on per the Court
Restitution released to victim.  /  CK# 16CH077357
Hrg for 12/8/16 moved to 12/15/16 due to court's unavailability.  NTBS
Hearing on December 15, 2016 at 09:30 am.
E-mailed Clerk to find out about restitution.  Restitution to be combined into current payment plan and to be paid first.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Lauren Breckenfelder.  Case brought to court today on the issue of the State not bringing contempt charges on failure of the deft to pay restitution.  Court will not approve this stipulation with the present wording; either the deft may stipulate to the restitution knowing he may face contempt charges for failure to pay restitution or the court will conduct a restitution hrg.  Court takes a short recess to allow defense counsel to confer w/her client.  Court reconvenes.  Defense counsel reports the deft wishes to stipulate to the restitution order.  Failure to pay restitution could result in new charges for contempt or the deft may be returned to court for contempt proceedings.  Court sets a hrg for 12/8/16 @ 1:30pm.
Hearing on July 21, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
File sent to Br 3 for review.
Restitution ordered in the amount of $2093.33
for Restitution Order filed by ADA Kraus

242 Clerk HM.   Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Defendant appears with Attorney Breckenfelder.     Representative for victim unable to appear today.  Atty Breckenfelder objects to adjmt.    Adjmt granted.    DE states he no longer has his tax refund - spent it.     Off record 245/on record 248.     DE willing to stip to restitution but state must agree to not file contempt charges against him.   State agrees.  Court orders restitution in the amt of $2,093.33 payable to Mayfair Rental Car.    Court will prepare order.
Restitution hearing on June 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Atty Breckenfelder unable to appear for 4/13 RSH and ADA does not object to rescheduling.
Restitution hearing at 04-13-2016 01:30 pm
File  sent to Room 300 for scheduling of restitution hrg.
Ct. 2
Cts. 1 & 3 - Dismissed

$967.00 due in 30 days or 20 days KCJ or 20 days work crew. 
$2466.14 Bal. Due on Restitution

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Lauren Breckenfelder.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty to count 2; found guilty by the Court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft fined $400 plus costs.  30 DTP.  In default, 20 days work crew or 20 days KCJ.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  Restitution is ordered; to be referred to Commissioner for determination.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Upon determination of restitution, it shall be paid w/in one year.  In default, State may bring deft back for contempt proceedings.  Deft is ordered by the Court to not dispose of his tax return w/o Court's permission other than to pay restitution.
Atty Lauren Breckenfelder
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
